Holiday Money Get in touch Book a video call Make an enquiry Call 0800 713 715 Help Get in touch Back NILE CRUISE SMALL GROUP TOUR View gallery / Back Karnak Temple Luxor Sphinx And Pyramids Egypt Egypt Pharaohs, Mummies and The Nile In Style 6 nights hotel • 4 night Nile Cruise • Sightseeing Overview Inclusions Terms & Conditions Discover the ancient wonders of Egypt on a small group carefully crafted tour. From your seamless arrival experience to your included Egyptologist guide and sailing down the Nile River on your boutique cruise ship, this tour highlights the best of Egypt. Small Group Tour (min 8 / max 16 passengers) View more View less 6 nights + Nile Cruise, sightseeing, transfers & more from $ 8990 per person share twin. Flights are additional NILE CRUISE SMALL GROUP TOUR Enquire now Sale Period : Until sold out Your inclusions 5 nights Cairo accommodation with daily breakfast 1 night Luxor accommodation with daily breakfast 4 night Nile cruise Daily breakfast, lunch & dinner on-board the Nile cruise Domestic flights - Cairo/Luxor and Aswan/Cairo Upgraded VIP Valley of the Kings ticket to include the tombs of Tutankhamun and Seti I Private English-speaking Egyptologist in Cairo & Luxor Small group sightseeing on Nile Cruise with English-speaking guide Welcome dinner & Farewell dinner Dinner on Day 2 at a local restaurant overlooking the pyramids High Tea at the Sofitel Old Cataract Hotel Return Airport to hotel transfers Fast Track meet and assistance prior to immigration at Cairo Airport Egyptian visa for US, Canadian, New Zealand, Australian and UK passport holders Price from From $10,250 per person share twin Travel: 28 Mar 25 From $8990 per person share twin Travel: 05 Sep 25 From $10,948 per person share twin Travel: 10 Oct & 07 Nov 25 Your itinerary Day 1: Cairo (D) Welcome to Egypt. On arrival at Cairo Airport, you will be met by our friendly local representative prior to immigration to assist with your included Egyptian visa. No need to be concerned about jet lag with the special express service through immigration. You will then be transferred in a private vehicle to the Hyatt Regency Cairo West Hotel. Remainder of the day at leisure. A welcome dinner is included this evening, meeting your guide and fellow travellers. We recommend arriving by 2pm to allow time for immigration and transfer to the hotel. Day 2: Cairo (B, D) Embark on a morning visit to the impressive site of the Pyramids. Construction began in 2690 BC, the Pyramids of Mycerinus, Chefren and the Great Pyramid of Cheops are the only survivors of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Face the mystical Sphinx, reputedly used as target practice by Napoleon’s troops. Lunch is in your own time. Continue to the ancient capital of Memphis and visit the Step Pyramids of Sakkara – the oldest surviving Egyptian pyramid. Dinner this evening, is in a special restaurant, on the roof top bar, overlooking the pyramids. Day 3: Cairo - Luxor (B) This morning embark on a captivating visit to the Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM), one of the largest and most comprehensive archaeological museums in the world located near the Pyramids. Spanning over 5,000 years of history, this museum boasts an extraordinary collection of artifacts that trace the rich cultural heritage of Egypt inspired by the boy King Tutankhamun. Currently in its "second soft-opening phase," the GEM has unveiled 12 of its main galleries, offering a glimpse into its vast treasures. As you step inside, you’ll be welcomed by the imposing figure of Ramses II, a colossal statue that has been relocated from Tahrir Square and now stands proudly in the museum’s grand foyer. From here, you'll journey through the newly opened galleries, where over 15,000 meticulously curated artifacts are displayed. These exhibits span millennia, showcasing the incredible achievements of ancient Egyptian civilization, from its earliest dynasties to the grandeur of its later empires. With each step, you'll delve deeper into the stories of pharaohs, gods, and everyday life, uncovering the mysteries and marvels of one of the world's oldest and most influential cultures. The GEM has an excellent choice of cafes and gift shops, so perhaps take a coffee break during your exploration. Note: Access to the Tutankhamun galleries is restricted until the official opening Transfer to Cairo Airport and fly to Luxor. On arrival you will be assisted by our local Luxor Airport team and transferred to the Sofitel Winter Palace Hotel for an overnight stay. It was here that Howard Carter announced from the grand staircase, that he had discovered the tomb of boy king Tutankhamun. Dinner this evening is your choice at a range of restaurants in the hotel, or perhaps dine locally. Day 4: Luxor - embark Nile Cruise (B,L,D) Later this morning transfer to embark via the centrally located, private dock for the Sonesta St George Nile cruise ship. This deluxe five-star ship offers the ultimate in comfort, elegance, and design. Featuring 47 deluxe cabins, each 22 sq. metres, with full French balcony sliding doors and Presidential Suites. As you embark, a welcome drink is included. Facilities include: BBQ area on the top deck, outdoor pool with Sundeck bar, restaurant, bar, gym, spa, sauna and jacuzzi, (optional Spa treatments by appointment-surcharge applies), Wi-Fi. Cabin amenities feature: L’Occitane toiletries, welcome bottle of wine, tea & coffee tray refilled daily, a bottle of mineral water delivered daily. Tea, coffee, and mineral water included daily with all meals. Option available to upgrade to a Presidential suite with full balcony. This afternoon, visit the magnificent Luxor Temple, built in the 14th century BC by two kings – Amenophis III and Ramses II. Follow the Avenue of the Sphinx to the Karnak Temple complex and gaze in awe at this imposing monument housing precious relics of Ancient Egyptian dynasties. Day 5: Luxor - Esna (B,L,D) Early this morning cross to the West Bank and visit Thebes Necropolis and the burial ground of the Pharaohs – the Valley of the Kings – where Howard Carter discovered the tomb of Tutankhamun in 1922. Proceed to the nearby Valley of the Queens, the mortuary temple of Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon facing the Nile. Explore the myriad of tombs and temples before cruising via Esna lock to Edfu. Your visit today includes a special upgraded ticket to include access to the boy king Tutankhamun and the special tomb of Pharoah Seti 1, from the 19th Dynasty. Rediscovered in 1817, it is one of the most colourful and best-preserved tombs on the West Bank. The last stop this morning is at the Habibi Cotton factory, located on the West Bank and providing employment for local women. Here high-quality Egyptian cotton garments, scarves, and beautiful art works, along with many other goods are produced, the opportunity to purchase is available. Continue and return to the ship with lunch on board. Lunch is served whilst sailing to Esna. This evening attend the captain’s welcome Cocktail party (non-alcoholic drinks served), followed by dinner. Overnight in Esna. Optional Hot Air Balloon Trip (surcharge applies) Day 6: Esna - Edfu - Kom Ombo (B,L,D) Early morning departure to Edfu, with a delicious breakfast aboard. Here visit the Temple of Horus, one of the best-preserved temples of the Greco-Roman era. Continue cruising to Kom Ombo and visit this Temple shared by two Gods – Sobek & Horus. The temple is perfectly symmetrical, ensuring neither God was offended. The collection of crocodile mummies held here is fascinating. Overnight in Kom Ombo, with the opportunity to view the sun setting over this spectacular temple. Day 7: Kom Ombo - Aswan (B,L,D) Early morning sailing to Aswan. This morning take your local boat across to the Philae Temple, dedicated to the goddess Isis and rescued from the rising waters of Lake Nasser at the time of the High Dam’s construction. Later visit the High Dam. Return for lunch on board and time to relax. Mid-afternoon transfer to the Sofitel Old Cataract, base for Dame Agatha Christie as she penned “Death on the Nile”. Savour a High Tea whilst sitting on this famous terrace overlooking the Nile. Later return to the ship for dinner this evening, followed by a colourful Nubian Show. Day 8: Aswan - Cairo (B,D) Disembark this morning, with time to explore Aswan. Optional Tours (surcharge applies): Option 1: Nubian Museum (Minimum of 2 required) After disembarkation meet your guide and transfer to the International Nubian Museum. The kings of Nubia ultimately conquered and ruled Egypt for a century. Known for its rich deposits of gold, Nubia was also the gateway for the incense trade, their rulers building cities, temples and their own royal pyramids. After your tour, time free to explore Aswan in your own time, before departing to the airport for your flight to Cairo. (Minimum of 2 required) Option 2: Abu Simbel Tour An early morning transfer from the cruise boat to Abu Simbel Airport. Depart on EgyptAir to Abu Simbel. On arrival be met by a local Egyptologist and join a small group tour to one of the most impressive archaeological sites in all of Egypt, not only for its historical significance, but for the great engineering success in moving these temples to their present location. Of all the temples of Egyptian antiquity, amongst the most spectacular and best preserved are the Temples of Abu Simbel. The master builder was Ramses II, one of Egypt’s greatest Pharaohs. The larger temple celebrates the Pharaoh himself while the smaller one honours his wife, Queen Nefertari. When the new Lake Nasser Dam was built in the 1960s, the temples were moved to save them from a watery grave. In an amazing feat of engineering, the temples were hewn into huge blocks of thirty tonnes each and relocated 180m further inland. Please wear sturdy footwear today, pack some snacks and water bottle. At the conclusion of your tour, transfer to Abu Simbel Airport, for your flight to Aswan, connecting to Cairo. Disembark this morning, with time to explore Aswan. This afternoon transfer to Aswan Airport and fly to Cairo. On arrival our Cairo Airport team will meet and assist. Transfer to the Cairo Marriott Hotel where you are reserved for three nights. Dinner is included at your hotel this evening. Day 9: Cairo (B) Today you will explore this modern cosmopolitan capital with a rich heritage of cultural influences and echoes of ancient civilisations. This morning visit the magnificently curated National Museum of Ancient Civilizations. The Museum’s vision is to bring the rich tapestry of tangible and intangible Egyptian heritage to life within a vibrant cultural, artistic and scientific context. After your visit which spans many millennia, move downstairs to the Mummy Room, to view their spectacular Mummy exhibits, in your own time. Time for a coffee break before departing to Mohammed Ali Mosque, and the Citadel which dominates Cairo’s skyline. Continue to the Khan El Khalili Bazaar, open since the 1382, with time for shopping. Conclude your day on a rooftop bar, watching the sun set over Cairo’s skyline, with a local drink of wine, beer or juice included. Return to the Cairo Marriott Hotel. Dinner this evening own arrangements. Day 10: Cairo (B,D) Optional Activities (surcharges apply): Option 1 : A morning visit to old Cairo’s Coptic Churches, including the Hanging Church. It was in this area that Jesus, Mary and Joseph stayed, and Christianity flourished, prior to the Islamic invasion. The area encompasses the Babylon Fortress the Coptic Museum, the Hanging Church, the Greek Church of St George amidst many other historical sites. Option 2: An early morning departure for a full day safari visiting Fayoum Oasis and the Valley of the Whales. Today travel into the desert via Fayoum Oasis to Wadi Al-Hitan (Valley of the Whales) where whale skeletons, have been preserved in a natural open-air Museum for millions of years. Entry to the Fossil and climate Museum is included. (Note: As this journey is through the White Desert, a part of the tour will be in a 4WD, with a local driver, in a thrilling mainly off-road drive. Lunch is included on today’s tour. Option 3: Half day golf at the Dreamland Golf Course-Hilton Hotel Pyramids Golf (or similar) Includes transfers to/from the Golf Course, 1 round-18 holes of golf, power cart and club rental. A farewell dinner is included this evening at a local restaurant. Day 11: Cairo (B) Two departure transfers are available to the airport, including one early morning and one mid-morning. Savour sailing down the Nile aboard the stylish deluxe cruise ship, the Sonesta St George. Each cabin features floor to ceiling opening windows, in French balcony style Roam the magnificent temples of Luxor and Karnak, as well as the Valley of the Kings and Queens – bonus entry into the tombs of Tutankhamun Marvel at the abundant treasures in the Grand Egyptian Museum Terms & Conditions Sales until sold out. Prices and availability are subject to change without notice until time of confirmation. Prices displayed are per person, based on two people travelling together in Deluxe Class. Upgrades are available, subject to availability and an extra cost. All featured tour itineraries and offers maybe subject to change due to seasonal variations without notice, or due to local conditions or other conditions. Prices are based on payment by cash or eftpos. Credit card fees will apply. Amendment and cancellation fees apply. International Airfares are not included and are at an additional cost. Supplements may apply for tours commencing on certain days. Nile Cruise itinerary may vary according to the cruise boat confirmed or may operate in reverse. Travel insurance is mandatory. Payment deadlines and conditions apply. FINANCE CONDITIONS: Lending criteria, fees, terms & conditions apply. Offer available for bookings made with House of Travel only. Not available for bookings made with MixandMatch. For finance terms and conditions visit hot.co.nz/payment-options. For full terms and conditions please ask your House of Travel Consultant.
